</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Checks if given position is inside road segment. Same as [[roadAt]], only return is boolean instead of road object. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''isOnRoad''' position</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Object]] or [[Array]] in format [[PositionAGL]] (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v1.99.146460) [[Position2D]], in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_objOnRoad = [[isOnRoad]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_posOnRoad = [[isOnRoad]] [[ASLToAGL]] [[getPosASL]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>[[nearRoads]], [[roadsConnectedTo]], [[roadAt]], [[surfaceIsWater]], [[getRoadInfo]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Some roadobjects will return false when using this command. invisibleroadway_square_f.p3d is found by the nearRoads command, yet will return false for isOnRoad.
